info.title: Appointment scheduling API
info.description:
## Appointment scheduling software API

[DaySchedule](https://dayschedule.com/) is a cloud-based appointment scheduling software that allows businesses to manage their appointments and reservations online. Our API documentation provides you detailed information on how to integrate DaySchedule into an existing website or application to access almost every feature of DaySchedule via the API.

The API can be used to perform various actions such as:

- Creating a resource: e.g event, [webinar](https://dayschedule.com/products/webinar-software) or services
- Creating [1:1](https://dayschedule.com/products/1-1-meeting-sofware), [round-robin](https://dayschedule.com/products/round-robin-scheduling-software) and [group events](https://dayschedule.com/products/group-scheduling-software)
- Checking available slot for a particular day, week or month
- Creating and updating an appointment
- Retrieving information about appointments and customers
- Canceling appointments
- Download booking and reports.

The API documentation includes information on authentication and authorization, request and response formats with example JSON for each endpoint.

### SDK

We’ve also included some programming language examples in Node.js,
Python, Java, PHP and C# to check the calendar availability and
book an appointment online using our REST API.

We are also publishing our official SDK and it's recommended
to use our SDK whenever available -

| Language                                                 |   Installation guide    |
| -------------------------------------------------------- | :---------------------: |
| [Node.js](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dayschedule-api) | `npm i dayschedule-api` |

## Endpoints

The root endpoint of DaySchedule API is: `https://api.dayschedule.com/v1` and we recommend you to fetch our API over `https`.

## Authentication Types

The DaySchedule API offers key based authentication:

- `apiKey` as query parameter

In order to start using API, you need a DaySchedule account. [Sign Up here](https://app.dayschedule.com/signup), if you don’t have one.

Once you are logged in, go to the Settings page and then [API keys page](https://app.dayschedule.com/settings/apikeys) to get your API key to start using the API.

![Api keys for dayschedule appointment software](https://cdn.dayschedule.com/img/dayschedule-appointment-api-keys.png)

We use keys to allow access and in order to authorize API requests. Just add your API key in the query parameter for each API requests `apiKey=xxxxxxx`

For example:

```
https://api.dayschedule.com/v1/bookings?apiKey=xxxxxxx
```

## Postman collection

You may also download our [Postman collection](https://github.com/dayschedule/dayschedule-api/releases) to try out the complete appointments API on postman

Follow the steps below -

1. [Download postman collection](https://github.com/dayschedule/dayschedule-api/releases)
2. Import in Postman
3. Create an environment on Postman with following parameters

```
API_KEY: Your api key
BASE_URL: https://api.dayschedule.com/v1
```

![Appointment booking API on Postman](https://cdn.dayschedule.com/img/dayschedule-api-postman.png)

## Rate limit

The appointment booking API is subject to a rate limit to ensure the fair usage and optimal performance. The rate-limit depends on your subscription plan:

| Plan       | Rate Limit (Requests per 10 seconds) |
|------------|--------------------------------------|
| Professional        | 60                                   |
| Business   | 120                                  |
| Enterprise | 300                                  |


This means that the API allows up to 60 requests per 10 seconds. If this limit is exceeded, additional requests within the same time frame will be rejected with `429` status code until the next 10-second interval begins. 

This helps us to prevent server overload and maintain a smooth experience for all our customers. 

For the [/availability API](/docs/api#tag/Availability), we recommend users to implement internal caching to cache the [available time slots](https://dayschedule.com/docs/t/how-to-set-working-hours-on-day-scheduling-app/298) for (n) seconds if the same date and resource_id are requested. This cached response should be invalidated [when a booking is created](https://dayschedule.com/docs/t/how-to-book-an-appointment-online/337). This approach will enhance your application’s speed and help you adhere to the API rate limit.

key.description: To provide custom aliases for short links. It will be auto-generated if not provided

expire_at.description: To expire the short link automatically on a given date time, or leave blank for no expiration.

get.description: Get time slots by resource id

schema.description: Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format to check the calendar availability. (Not applicable if particular date range is specified in the event using `within a date ranges` option)
End date in YYYY-MM-DD format to check the calendar availability
Must be a valid time zone, or leave blank to apply the time zone selected in the event

capacity.description: The available booking capacity for a date. (Bookings limit set - total booking)

available.description: Total available users/limit for this slot. (Per slot limit can be specified in group event)

users.description: List of user ids available for this slot

hours.description: List of available time slots in selected time zone

slots.description: List of all the time slots

time_zone.description: Time zone used by the slot generator

users.description: List of all the users selected in this event, webinar or service
